text:
🇯🇵  Preview | [#BOJ](https://twitter.com/hashtag/BOJ) To End Negative Rates This Week

1) Results of Wage Negotiations Will Force BOJ’s Hand

➡ According to Rengo’s report, the country's largest union group agreed to increase significantly wages by 5.28% of growth last Friday along 2024 during the Japan’s spring wage round. The Japanese Trade Union Confederation made the heftiest pay hikes in 33 years, well higher than both recent market consensus of 3.90% and last year's rate of 3.58%. It has been previously indicated by the BOJ Governor, Kazuo Ueda, that the spring wage hikes will play a significant role in the central bank's evaluation of the feasibility of achieving the 2% price stability target in a sustainable and stable manner.

text: Nvidia's AI GPUs are getting big. "When somebody says GPU, I see this. Two years ago when I saw a GPU it was the HGX. It was 70lbs, 35,000 parts. Our GPUs now are 600,000 parts and 3,000lbs. That's kind of like the weight of a carbon fiber Ferrari," says Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang
author: Tom Warren (@tomwarren) ✧

text:
What happened: no more donations from SBF? <quote>🚨NEW: The [@​SECGov](https://twitter.com/SECGov) has just dropped its FY 2025 budget request, asking for $2.594B, up more than $100M from 2024. 

[@​GaryGensler](https://twitter.com/GaryGensler) mentions [#crypto](https://twitter.com/hashtag/crypto), [#AI](https://twitter.com/hashtag/AI), data transparency and beefing up cybersecurity as areas of focus for the extra funds. 

Notably, the agency is investing in new cybersecurity initiatives including Zero Trust Architecture which implements continuous verification of users, devices, and networks within the agency. 

Also notably, Gensler describes the SEC’s funding as “deficit neutral” with appropriations offset by transaction fees, but the agency under-collected on those fees by $50M this year, meaning the agency is not deficit neutral. In 2023, the SEC under-collected by $414M. 

For perspective, the [@​CFTC](https://twitter.com/CFTC) is asking for a budget of just $399M to operate in 2025, less than the [@​SECGov](https://twitter.com/SECGov)’s deficit in 2023. 

Full budget justification here:

https://www.sec.gov/files/fy-2025-congressional-budget-justification.pdf[#page](https://twitter.com/hashtag/page)=5</quote>
author: zerohedge (@zerohedge) ✧

text:
This data point overwhelmingly swung the consensus in favor of the Bank of Japan hiking interest rates today for the first time in 17 years, eliminating the YCC (yield curve control) regime, and ending some asset purchases.
We should consider this a step in a long-awaited normalization journey.
The initial moves are unlikely to significantly disrupt financial markets in other advanced economies. However, what comes later in this BoJ policy journey will be particularly interesting.

text:
FOMO Buying is very dangerous!

This trader lost 3,731 $SOL($775K) in just 1 hour by trading $SLERF!

He spent 5,004 $SOL to buy 790,236 $SLERF at $1.32(the highest price point). 

The price of $SLERF began to plummet after his purchase.

When $SLERF rose again, he spent another 2,500 $SOL($517K) to buy 650,330 $SLERF at $0.8.

Unfortunately, the price of $SLERF dropped again after his purchase.

In the end, he sold all $SLERF and only got 3,774 $SOL($784K) back, with a loss of 3,731 $SOL($775K).

https://solscan.io/account/cQ7PrKwoHU2bnbSDCDY4HHXpoKe5jr1DWH7fAqjSCz8[#splTransfers](https://twitter.com/hashtag/splTransfers)

author: Bloomberg (@business) ✧

text:
The Bank of [#Japan](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Japan)'s policy measures are as expected, including a rate hike from -0.1% to 0.0-0.1% and ending the YCC regime.
As regards the accompanying statement:
These steps were packaged relatively dovishly, including no mention of future steps in a long normalization journey.
This dovish packaging helps explain the fall in yields, stocks, and currency.
[#economy](https://twitter.com/hashtag/economy) [#boj](https://twitter.com/hashtag/boj) [#centralbanks](https://twitter.com/hashtag/centralbanks) [#markets](https://twitter.com/hashtag/markets) [#econtwitter](https://twitter.com/hashtag/econtwitter)
